Palakkad: Embracing Nature’s GrandeurBest Time To Visit KeralaJoin our travel community for the latest tips, guides, and exclusive offers!Subscribe You have already subscribed our newsletter!Thanks for Subscribing our newsletter!Embarking on a Kerala tour opens up romantic possibilities for couples seeking an enchanting getaway.  For those searching for ideas for honeymoon places in Kerala, this comprehensive Kerala honeymoon travel guide will help you discover the top honeymoon places in Kerala. Reverently known as “God’s Own Country,” Kerala captivates nature enthusiasts and serves as a heaven for honeymooners. The diverse landscapes, cultural richness, and warm hospitality of Kerala create the perfect setting for couples to nurture their love amidst lush greenery, serene backwaters, and pristine beaches. Explore the best honeymoon places in Kerala, where every moment is a celebration of love!Unveiling 10 Enchanting Honeymoon Places In Kerala1. Munnar: Where Romance Meets Misty MountainsNestled in the Western Ghats, Munnar is evidence of Kerala’s unmatched natural beauty. This hill station, draped in tea plantations and mist-kissed landscapes, is a dreamy escape for newlyweds. The rolling hills of Munnar provide a serene backdrop for couples to unwind and connect making it one of the best places for couples in Kerala. Exploring the tea estates hand in hand, taking a romantic boat ride in Kundala Lake, and witnessing the sunrise at Anamudi Peak are just a few of the enchanting experiences awaiting honeymooners in Munnar.Places To Visit: Tea Plantations: Begin your journey by strolling hand in hand. Visit the Tata Tea Museum to delve into the history of Munnar’s tea culture.Kundala Lake: Take a romantic boat ride on Kundala Lake, surrounded by rolling hills and lush greenery perfect for couples seeking moments of intimacy.Anamudi Peak: For the adventurous couple, a trek to Anamudi Peak, the highest point in South India, offers breathtaking panoramic views. The sunrise from this vantage point paints the sky with hues of orange and pink.Things To Do:Spa Retreats: Pamper yourselves with rejuvenating spa treatments amidst the serene landscapes. Many resorts in Munnar offer couples’ spa packages, allowing you to unwind together is one of the most amazing things to do in Kerala.Adventurous Trails: Embark on nature trails and treks around Munnar’s hills. The Attukal Waterfalls trek, in particular, is a romantic escapade.Candlelight Dinners: Many resorts and restaurants in Munnar offer intimate candlelight dinners with panoramic views of the hills.What To Buy & From Where:Tea: Purchase high-quality tea leaves and aromatic blends from the local tea estates or the Munnar Tea Museum a souvenir of the best honeymoon place in Kerala.Spices: Munnar is renowned for its spice plantations. Buy authentic spices like cardamom, pepper, and cinnamon from local markets.Handicrafts: Explore the local markets for handmade artefacts and souvenirs. Wooden carvings, traditional Kerala sarees, and intricately designed artefacts.2. Alleppey: A Cruise through the Backwaters of LoveDiscussion about Kerala isn’t complete without mentioning the enchanting backwaters. and Alleppey (Alappuzha) is the epitome of this experience. Referred to as the “Venice of the East,” Alleppey offers couples a chance to sail through a network of canals, lakes, and lagoons in traditional houseboats known as ‘kettuvallams.’ A romantic cruise along the backwaters, surrounded by swaying palm trees and picturesque landscapes, provides an intimate setting for couples to celebrate their love in one of the best honeymoon spots in Kerala. Places To Visit: Alleppey Backwaters: Indulge in a private houseboat cruise through the intricate network of backwaters. Traverse the serene Vembanad Lake and canals.Pathiramanal Island: A secluded island on the Vembanad Lake, Pathiramanal is a haven for bird watchers and nature enthusiasts. Alappuzha Beach: Stroll along the pristine Alappuzha Beach hand in hand, where the golden sands meet the gentle waves of the Arabian Sea.Things To Do:Houseboat Stay: Opt for a romantic stay on a traditional houseboat, where you can enjoy panoramic views and delicious Kerala cuisine.Shikara Ride: For a more intimate experience, take a Shikara ride through the narrow canals of Alleppey. Glide through the waterways as you witness the simple and serene life of the locals.Ayurvedic Spa: Rejuvenate with a couples’ Ayurvedic spa session. Many resorts and wellness centres in Alleppey offer traditional Ayurvedic treatments, ensuring a holistic experience in this honeymoon place of Kerala.What To Buy & From Where:Coir Products: Alleppey is famous for its coir industry. Purchase intricately woven coir products like mats, carpets, and wall hangings.Traditional Kerala Attire: Explore local markets for traditional Kerala sarees and attire. Seafood Delicacies: If possible, buy local spices and seafood specialities. Alleppey is known for its fresh catches, and bringing home some unique spices will allow you to recreate the flavours of the region.Suggested Read: Places To Visit In Cannes On Honeymoon For Newlyweds3. Kovalam: Sun-Kissed Beach BlissFor couples seeking a romantic beach getaway, Kovalam is one of the must-visit budget honeymoon destinations in Kerala. This coastal town, adorned with golden sands and clear blue waters, offers a perfect blend of relaxation and adventure making it one of the most romantic places in Kerala. Honeymooners can bask in the sun on the pristine beaches of Kerala, indulge in water sports, and witness the mesmerising sunset at the iconic Lighthouse Beach. The laid-back atmosphere and luxurious beachfront resorts make Kovalam an ideal spot for couples looking to unwind in a tropical paradise.Places To Visit: Lighthouse Beach: Named after the iconic lighthouse at its southern end, Lighthouse Beach is the heart of Kovalam. Enjoy a stroll along the shore, take in the vibrant atmosphere, and bask in the warm glow of the sun.Hawa Beach: Also known as Eve’s Beach, Hawa Beach is a quieter stretch with golden sands and gentle waves. It provides a more secluded setting, perfect for couples seeking privacy amidst the natural beauty making Kovalam one of the best places to visit in Kerala for honeymoon. Samudra Beach: The northernmost beach in Kovalam, Samudra Beach is less crowded and offers a serene environment. Enjoy the rhythmic sound of the waves and the tranquillity of the shoreline.Things To Do:Ayurvedic Massages: Unwind with a rejuvenating Ayurvedic massage by the beach. Kovalam boasts numerous Ayurvedic centres offering traditional wellness treatments.Water Sports: For the adventurous couple, Kovalam offers opportunities for water sports such as parasailing, jet-skiing, and surfing. Dive into the azure waters for an exhilarating experience together.Beachside Dining: Enjoy romantic dinners at beachside shacks and restaurants. The seafood in Kovalam is a must-try, and the ambience of dining under the stars adds to the charm.What To Buy & From Where:Seashell Jewellery: Purchase locally crafted seashell jewellery from beachside stalls and indulge in shopping in Kerala.Beachwear & Fabrics: Explore the markets for vibrant beachwear, sarongs, and fabrics. Kovalam’s markets offer a variety of colourful clothing reflecting the coastal lifestyle.Local Art & Crafts: Support local artisans by purchasing handmade crafts. Look for wooden carvings, paintings, and other coastal-themed artworks.4. Thekkady: A Wildlife Romance Amidst Periyar National ParkFor nature-loving couples, Thekkady, located near the border of Tamil Nadu, is one of the top honeymoon locations in Kerala. It is a haven of greenery and wildlife. Periyar National Park, home to diverse flora and fauna, provides a unique backdrop for a perfect honeymoon spot in Kerala filled with adventure and tranquillity. Couples can explore the spice plantations, take a boat ride on Periyar Lake, and even spot wildlife during a jungle safari. Thekkady’s cool climate and lush surroundings create a romantic atmosphere for couples to immerse themselves in the beauty of nature.Places To Visit: Periyar National Park: Immerse yourselves in the captivating wildlife at Periyar National Park. Take a boat safari on Periyar Lake to spot elephants, deer, and a variety of bird species in their natural habitat. It is the most popular place to visit in Thekkady.Spice Plantations: Explore the aromatic spice plantations of Thekkady, where you can witness the cultivation of cardamom, pepper, and other spices. Mangala Devi Temple: For a touch of spirituality and panoramic views, visit the Mangala Devi Temple, perched atop a hill. The trek to the temple is an adventurous and romantic escapade in one of the best honeymoon places in Kerala.Things To Do:Bamboo Rafting: Experience the thrill of bamboo rafting on the Periyar River. This unique adventure allows you to navigate through the dense forests, creating an intimate and exciting experience.Elephant Junction: Interact with these gentle giants at Elephant Junction. Enjoy an elephant ride or participate in a bath together.Spa & Wellness: Rejuvenate your senses with spa treatments amidst the serene landscapes. Many resorts in Thekkady offer Ayurvedic treatments and wellness packages for couples.What To Buy & From Where:Spices: Thekkady is renowned for its spice plantations. Purchase high-quality spices directly from the local markets.Handwoven Crafts: Explore the local markets for handwoven textiles and crafts. Thekkady is known for its traditional bamboo and cane products.Natural Oils & Ayurvedic Products: Bring back the therapeutic essence of Thekkady with locally produced natural oils and Ayurvedic products. Suggested Read: Kerala In June5. Varkala: Cliffside Romance by the Arabian SeaVarkala, perched on the cliffs overlooking the Arabian Sea, offers a unique and romantic coastal experience. The dramatic cliffs, lined with vibrant shops and cafes, create a charming ambience for couples making Varkala one of the best places to visit in Kerala for honeymoon.Known for its mineral-rich cliffs and pristine sands, Varkala Beach is one of the best Kerala honeymoon places to relax, rejuvenate, and take in breathtaking views. The beachside shacks and cliff-top resorts provide the perfect setting for intimate moments and memorable evenings by the sea.Places To Visit: Varkala Beach: Start your journey at Varkala Beach, a golden stretch of sand embraced by towering cliffs. The beach’s mineral-rich cliffs provide a stunning backdrop.Janardanaswamy Temple: Explore the Janardanaswamy Temple, a 2000-year-old religious site with architectural marvels.Varkala Cliff: Stroll along the cliffside promenade, dotted with lively cafes, shops, and guesthouses. The panoramic views of the Arabian Sea from the cliff offer a picturesque setting for romantic moments.Things To Do:Ayurvedic Wellness: Indulge in Ayurvedic massages and wellness treatments offered in the numerous beachfront Ayurvedic centres. Yoga & Meditation: Join a yoga or meditation class along the cliffs, where experienced instructors guide you through practices to rejuvenate your mind and body.Sunset Views: Witness the breathtaking sunset over the Arabian Sea from one of the cliffside viewpoints. What To Buy & From Where:Hippie and Bohemian Fashion: Explore the shops along the cliff for bohemian clothing, jewellery, and accessories. Varkala’s markets are known for their eclectic and laid-back fashion.Ayurvedic Products: Purchase locally crafted Ayurvedic skincare and wellness products. These organic and herbal items make for thoughtful and rejuvenating souvenirs.Shell and Stone Crafts: Discover intricately crafted shell and stone jewellery at beachside stalls. These unique pieces reflect the coastal charm and can be cherished as reminders of your time in Varkala.6. Wayanad: A Tranquil Retreat in Nature’s LapWayanad is a perfect Kerala hill station for honeymoon surrounded by lush green landscapes, dense forests, and cascading waterfalls. This hill station in northern Kerala is a sanctuary for nature-loving couples seeking seclusion and serenity making Wayanad one of the best honeymoon places in Kerala.Wayanad offers opportunities for trekking, exploring caves, and visiting ancient temples. The Chembra Peak, Soochipara Falls, Banasura Sagar Dam, and Edakkal Caves are among the many attractions that make Wayanad a romantic retreat for couples looking to connect with nature.Places To Visit:Chembra Peak: Begin your journey at Chembra Peak, the highest point in Wayanad. A trek to the summit rewards you with panoramic views of the Western Ghats.Soochipara Falls: Explore the enchanting Soochipara Falls, where water cascades down rocky cliffs amidst thick forests.Banasura Sagar Dam: Visit the Banasura Sagar Dam, the largest earth dam in India. The surrounding hills, the crystal-clear lake, and the lush islands create a scenic backdrop for a romantic boat ride.Things To Do:Bamboo Rafting On Kuruva Island: Embark on a bamboo rafting adventure on the calm waters surrounding Kuruva Island.Edakkal Caves Exploration: Discover the Edakkal Caves, known for their ancient rock carvings. The trek to the caves through dense forests adds an element of adventure, while the historical significance creates a unique experience.Blessings At Thirunelli Temple: Seek blessings for your new journey at Thirunelli Temple, an ancient pilgrimage site surrounded by mountains and dense forests.Embark on a bamboo rafting adventure on the calm waters surrounding Kuruva Island.What To Buy & From Where:Handwoven Textiles: Explore local markets for handwoven fabrics and traditional sarees. Wayanad’s textile industry produces vibrant and intricately designed products.Local Honey & Spices: Purchase pure honey and a variety of spices from the local markets. Wayanad’s organic produce, including cardamom, pepper, and vanilla, is known for its quality and flavour.Traditional Wooden Crafts: Look for intricately carved wooden artefacts and crafts. Wayanad’s artisans showcase their skill in creating unique pieces that reflect the natural beauty of the region.7. Kumarakom: A Symphony of Backwaters and Bird SanctuariesSituated on the Vembanad Lake, Kumarakom is one of the most beautiful honeymoon destinations in Kerala. It is a charming backwater destination known for its bird sanctuaries and lush landscapes. Honeymooners can take a leisurely boat ride through the canals, visit the Kumarakom Bird Sanctuary, and experience the traditional Kerala houseboat honeymoon!The tranquillity of the backwaters combined with the vibrant avian life creates a romantic ambience, perfect for couples seeking a peaceful escape making it the best honeymoon place in Kerala.Places To Visit: Kumarakom Bird Sanctuary: Begin your exploration at the renowned Kumarakom Bird Sanctuary. Spread across 14 acres, this sanctuary is home to various migratory and resident bird species. Vembanad Lake: Cruise along the Vembanad Lake on a houseboat to experience the backwaters of Kumarakom. The expansive lake, fringed with coconut palms and picturesque villages, provides a romantic backdrop for couples to unwind and enjoy the serene waters.Aruvikkuzhi Waterfalls: For a touch of adventure, visit Aruvikkuzhi Waterfalls, located amidst rubber plantations and dense forests.Things To Do:Houseboat Stay: Opt for a romantic stay on a traditional houseboat. Drift along the tranquil backwaters, savouring delicious Kerala cuisine, and enjoy the privacy of your floating abode.Ayurvedic Spa: Pamper yourselves with rejuvenating Ayurvedic spa treatments. Many resorts in Kumarakom offer specialised wellness packages, allowing you to unwind together amidst the soothing ambience.Village Walks: Take a stroll through the nearby villages to experience the local way of life. Engage with the friendly residents, witness traditional activities, and immerse yourselves in the cultural richness of Kumarakom.What To Buy & From Where:Handwoven Coconut Fiber Products: Explore local markets for handwoven products made from coconut fibers. Items like mats, baskets, and coir handicrafts showcase the traditional craftsmanship of Kumarakom.Spices & Herbal Products: Purchase aromatic spices and herbal products directly from local markets. Kumarakom’s spice gardens produce high-quality spices, and herbal products that offer a slice of Kerala’s natural bounty.Handcrafted Souvenirs: Look for handcrafted souvenirs such as wooden carvings, shell items, and traditional Kerala artwork. These pieces serve as reminders of your romantic sojourn in Kumarakom.8. Poovar: Where Backwaters Meet the SeaPoovar, nestled in the southern tip of Kerala, stands out as an unspoiled gem. It is one of the best honeymoon spots in Kerala offering a unique blend of backwaters and beaches, making it one of the most enchanting honeymoon places in Kerala.Couples can delight in a captivating boat ride through the estuaries, bask in the serenity of Poovar Beach’s golden sands, and marvel at the breathtaking confluence of the Neyyar River and the Arabian Sea. With its pristine beauty and untouched landscapes, Poovar emerges as an idyllic Kerala honeymoon destination, providing couples with the perfect blend of privacy and natural splendour.Places To Visit:Poovar Beach: Start your journey at the pristine Poovar Beach. With its golden sands and gentle waves, this secluded beach provides a romantic setting for couples to relax and soak in the sun. Neyyar Estuary: Embark on a boat ride through the Neyyar Estuary, where the river and sea merge. The tranquil backwaters surrounded by lush greenery create a serene ambience, allowing couples to enjoy moments of solitude in nature’s embrace.Golden Sand Beach: Explore the unique Golden Sand Beach on the estuary side, accessible only by boat. The shimmering golden sands and the serene atmosphere offer a romantic hideaway for couples seeking seclusion.Things To Do:Boat Cruise: Opt for a romantic boat cruise through the backwaters, witnessing the picturesque landscapes and diverse birdlife. Many resorts in Poovar offer private boat rides, ensuring an intimate experience.Ayurvedic Wellness: Indulge in Ayurvedic spa treatments offered by beachside resorts. Let the sound of the waves and the therapeutic touch of traditional Ayurveda create a blissful and rejuvenating experience.Thirparappu Falls Visit: Take a day trip to Thirparappu Falls, located nearby. The cascading waters amidst lush greenery provide a refreshing escape, and the surrounding landscapes are ideal for a leisurely picnic.What To Buy & From Where:Seashell Crafts: Purchase handcrafted seashell jewellery and decor items from local artisans. These delicate creations reflect the coastal aesthetics and can serve as beautiful mementos.Local Handicrafts: Explore the local markets for traditional handicrafts made by skilled artisans. Wooden carvings, bamboo products, and traditional Kerala artworks make for authentic and culturally rich souvenirs.Spices & Ayurvedic Products: Purchase locally sourced spices and Ayurvedic products. Poovar’s proximity to spice plantations ensures the availability of high-quality spices, and Ayurvedic products offer a touch of wellness from the region.9. Kochi: Cultural Charms and Coastal VibesKochi, also known as Cochin, seamlessly blends history, culture, and coastal beauty. Honeymooners can explore the historic Fort Kochi, stroll through the charming streets of Jew Town, and witness the iconic Chinese Fishing Nets along the waterfront. The cultural richness of Kochi, reflected in its art galleries, museums, and ancient architecture, adds a unique dimension to the honeymoon experience. Enjoy a romantic sunset cruise in the Arabian Sea or indulge in the local culinary delights for a truly memorable experience.Places To Visit: Fort Kochi: Begin your journey in the historic district of Fort Kochi, known for its colonial-era architecture and narrow winding streets. Explore the Fort Kochi Beach, St. Francis Church, and the iconic Chinese Fishing Nets that dot the coastline.Jew Town: Wander through Jew Town, a colourful neighborhood with a rich history. Visit the Paradesi Synagogue, the oldest active synagogue in the Commonwealth, and explore antique shops and spice markets that showcase Kochi’s trading heritage.Mattancherry Palace: Discover the Mattancherry Palace, also known as the Dutch Palace, showcasing Kerala mural art and artefacts that depict the region’s cultural and historical evolution.Things To Do:Kathakali Performance: Witness a traditional Kathakali dance performance, a classical dance form that originated in Kerala. The elaborate costumes, expressive gestures, and vibrant makeup create a captivating experience.Backwater Cruise: Experience the backwaters of Kochi with a leisurely cruise. Opt for a sunset cruise to witness the coastal beauty as the sun sets over the Arabian Sea, casting a golden hue over the waters.Culinary Exploration: Indulge in the local culinary delights. Kochi is renowned for its seafood, and the bustling street food scene in places like Princess Street and Bazaar Road offers a chance to savour authentic Kerala flavors.What To Buy & From Where:Spices & Tea: Explore the spice markets for high-quality spices and Kerala tea blends. The fragrant spices and aromatic teas make for delightful gifts and culinary additions.Antiques & Artefacts: Visit antique shops in Jew Town for unique artefacts and curios that tell stories of Kochi’s rich history. Wooden carvings, brassware, and vintage items can be found in these eclectic stores.Handicrafts: Support local artisans by purchasing handmade handicrafts. Look for traditional Kathakali masks, coir products, and handwoven textiles that showcase the artistic skills of Kochi’s craftsmen.Suggested Read: Hill Stations In Kerala10. Palakkad: Embracing Nature’s GrandeurKnown as the “Gateway of Kerala,” Palakkad is a concealed treasure that ensures a serene retreat for honeymooners, establishing itself as one of the enchanting honeymoon places in Kerala. Embraced by the Western Ghats, Palakkad unfolds with verdant landscapes, historic forts, and tranquil lakes. Attractions like the Palakkad Fort, Malampuzha Dam, and Silent Valley National Park offer couples an exquisite fusion of history, nature, and seclusion. Palakkad’s invigorating climate and scenic allure render it an unconventional yet romantically alluring choice for couples in search of a peaceful honeymoon getaway in Kerala.Places To Visit: Palakkad Fort: Begin your exploration at the Palakkad Fort, a well-preserved historical site with thick stone walls and a large gateway. Climb to the top of the fort to enjoy panoramic views of the surrounding town and lush greenery.Malampuzha Dam and Gardens: Discover the Malampuzha Dam, an impressive structure built across the Malampuzha River. Explore the beautifully landscaped Malampuzha Gardens, featuring flower beds, fountains, and a suspension bridgeSilent Valley National Park: For nature enthusiasts, a visit to the Silent Valley National Park is a must. Home to a diverse range of flora and fauna, this pristine wilderness offers trekking opportunities. Things To Do:Dhoni Hills Trek: Embark on a trek to Dhoni Hills, a scenic spot known for its lush greenery and the Dhoni Waterfalls. The trek offers breathtaking views of the Western Ghats and an opportunity to connect with nature.Visit Nelliyampathy: Take a day trip to Nelliyampathy, a hill station with panoramic views of the mountains and valleys. The winding roads, tea plantations, and cool climate create a romantic setting for couples seeking tranquillity.Parambikulam Wildlife Sanctuary: Explore the Parambikulam Wildlife Sanctuary, a haven for wildlife lovers. Join a safari to spot elephants, deer, and a variety of bird species in their natural habitat.What To Buy & From Where:Palakkadan Matta Rice: Purchase the famous Palakkadan Matta Rice, known for its unique taste and nutritional benefits. This local rice variety is a staple in Kerala cuisine and makes for a practical yet authentic souvenir.Handloom Textiles: Explore local markets for handloom textiles and sarees. Palakkad is known for its traditional handwoven fabrics with vibrant colours and intricate designs, offering a slice of the region’s craftsmanship.Art & Crafts: Support local artists by purchasing handmade crafts. Look for traditional Palakkad artworks, pottery, and wooden crafts that reflect the artistic traditions of the region.Best Time To Visit KeralaVisit Kerala between September and March when the weather is perfect! These pleasant months let you fully enjoy Kerala’s natural beauty. If you’re dreaming of a romantic backwater cruise, plan your trip between November and February. ConclusionKerala, with its diverse landscapes and rich cultural tapestry, offers an array of romantic experiences for honeymooners. Whether you prefer misty mountains, tranquil backwaters, or sun-kissed beaches, Kerala has the perfect setting for every couple.As you embark on this journey of love in “God’s Own Country,” each destination becomes a chapter in your unique love story, creating memories that will last a lifetime.Get exclusive travel insights & updates into your inbox!Subscribe *By clicking subscribe you'll receive emails from WanderOn.You have already subscribed our newsletter!Thanks for Subscribing our newsletter!Shrutika Parab★★★★★24 May 2024“Thank you Team Wanderon for the amazing Ladakh Experience.
